title: Biofuel statistics: Year 5 (2012/13), report 1
summary: This publication presents statistics on the Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation (RTFO) for the obligation year 15 April 2012 to 14 July 2012 (Year 5).
body:
## Summary

This publication presents statistics on the Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation (RTFO) for the obligation year 15 April 2012 to 14 July 2012 (Year 5).

It includes information on:

  * the amount of UK road transport fuel from renewable and fossil fuel;
  * the number of Renewable Transport Fuel Certificates (RTFCs) which have been issued to sustainable renewable fuel;
  * the balance of RTFCs by obligation period;
  * trades of RTFCs between suppliers and/or traders; and,
  * carbon and sustainability (C&S) characteristics of the renewable fuel supplied.

## Download the full release

  * [Biofuel statistics: Year 5 (2012/13), report 1 (PDF - 69 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/biofuel-statistics-year-five-2012-13-report-one/rtfo-2012-13-year-five-report-one.pdf)

### The headline figures are:

  * 6.3 billion litres of renewable transport fuel have been supplied in the 51 months since the RTFO began.

### In the first quarter of Year 5 of the RTFO (14 April 2012 to 15 July 2012):

  * 321 million litres of renewable fuel have been supplied, which is 2.9% of total road transport fuel reported to the RTFO Administrator against an annual obligation of 4.5%.
  * More bioethanol (60%) has been supplied than biodiesel (36%). There were also small volumes of biogas, biomethanol, methyl tertiary butyl ether (MTBE) and pure vegetable oil.
  * 154 million RTFCs have been issued of which 69 million were for double counting feedstocks.

### C&S characteristics of the biofuels to which RTFCs have been issued (37% of the total biofuel)1:

  * The largest proportion of renewable fuel was derived from non-European Community corn (66 million litres, 55% of total biofuel to which RTFCs have been issued). The most widely reported source (by feedstock and country of origin) for biodiesel was used cooking oil from the USA (8 million litres, 31% of biodiesel to which RTFCs have been issued). The most widely sourced bioethanol was corn from the United States of America (65 million litres, 76% of bioethanol to which RTFCs have been issued).
  * 11% of renewable fuel was sourced from UK feedstocks.
  * An aggregate greenhouse gas saving of 59% compared to fossil fuels was achieved. This figure excludes emissions from indirect land-use change.

1 The final deadline for applying for RTFCs is 12 August following the obligation period.

## Download all tables

  * [Biofuel statistics: Year 5 (2012/13), report 1 XLS tables (XLS - 55 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/biofuel-statistics-year-five-2012-13-report-one/rtfo-2012-13-year-five-report-one.xls)

## Technical information

Information on biofuels statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation, can be found here:

  * [Biofuels](/statistics/series/biofuels/)

## Related statistical releases

The previous statistical releases can be found at:

  * [Previous statistical releases](/statistics?tag=biofuel/)

## Contact us

  * [rtfo-compliance@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:rtfo-compliance@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 8555

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [rtfo-compliance@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:rtfo-compliance@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Biofuel statistics: Year 4 (2011/12), report 5
summary: This publication presents statistics on the Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation (RTFO) for the obligation year 15 April 2011 to 14 April 2012 (Year 4).
body:
## Summary

This publication presents statistics on the Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation (RTFO) for the obligation year 15 April 2011 to 14 April 2012 (Year 4).

It includes information on:

  * the amount of UK road transport fuel from renewable and fossil fuel;
  * the number of Renewable Transport Fuel Certificates (RTFCs) which have been issued to sustainable renewable fuel;
  * the balance of RTFCs by obligation period;
  * trades of RTFCs between suppliers and/or traders; and,
  * carbon and sustainability (C&S) characteristics of the renewable fuel supplied1.

## Download the full release

  * [Biofuel statistics: Year 4 (2011/12), report 5 (PDF - 72 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/biofuel-statistics-year-four-2011-12-report-five/rtfo-2011-12-year-four-report-five.pdf)

### The headline figures are:

  * Six billion litres of renewable transport fuel have been supplied in the 48 months since the RTFO began.

### In Year 4 (14 April 2011 to 15 April 2012) of the RTFO:

  * 1.6 billion litres of renewable fuel have been supplied, which is 3.6% of total road transport fuel reported to the RTFO Administrator against an annual obligation of 4.0%. 
  * More biodiesel (57%) has been supplied than bioethanol (43%). There were also small volumes of biogas, biomethanol and pure vegetable oil.
  * 1.7 billion RTFCs have been issued of which 464 million were for double counting feedstocks.

### From 15 Dec 2011 to 14 Apr 2012:

  * 43% of the Year 4 RTFCs were issued to biofuel supplied in this period.
  * The largest proportion of renewable fuel was derived from used cooking oil (229 million litres, 45% of total biofuel supplied). The most widely reported source (by feedstock and country of origin) for biodiesel was used cooking oil from the Netherlands (48 million litres, 18% of biodiesel supplied). The most widely sourced bioethanol was corn from the United States of America (163 million litres, 69% of bioethanol supplied).
  * 12% of renewable fuel was sourced from UK feedstocks.
  * An aggregate greenhouse gas saving of 63% compared to fossil fuels was achieved. This figure excludes emissions from indirect land-use change.

1 This report contains fuel volume and RTFC data for the whole obligation period, and verified C&S data on renewable fuels supplied for the period after implementation of the Renewable Energy Directive (15 December 2011 to 14 April 2012). Unverified C&S data for renewable fuels supplied for the period 15 April to 14 December 2011 can be found on the [ DfT website](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/series/biofuels). We expect to publish verified data for this period in February 2013

## Download all tables

  * [Biofuel statistics: Year 4 (2011/12), report 5 XLS tables (XLS - 68 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/biofuel-statistics-year-four-2011-12-report-five/rtfo-2011-12-year-four-report-five.xls)

## Technical information

Information on biofuels statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation, can be found here:

  * [Biofuels](/statistics/series/biofuels/)

## Related statistical releases

The previous statistical releases can be found at:

  * [Previous statistical releases](/statistics?tag=biofuel/)

## Contact us

  * [rtfo-compliance@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:rtfo-compliance@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 8555

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)

title: Blue badge scheme statistics: 2011/12
summary: This statistical release presents information on parking badges for disabled people (“Blue Badges”) in England in 2011/12, including numbers of valid badges on issue, and the number issued in the 2011/12 financial year.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This statistical release presents information on parking badges for disabled people ("Blue Badges") in England in 2011/12, including numbers of valid badges on issue, and the number issued in the 2011/12 financial year. The data are derived from the Department's annual survey of local authorities issuing Blue Badges.

## Download the full release

  * [Blue badge scheme statistics 2011/12 (PDF - 57 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/blue-badge-scheme-statistics-2011-12/blue-badge-2011-12.pdf)

## Key points

  * On 31 March 2012, the estimated number of valid Blue Badges held was 2.62 million, a decrease of 1.1 per cent from the revised figure of 2.65 million for the previous year, which was the highest annual figure recorded. This is the first year to experience a decline since 1997.
  * Of this total, 37 per cent were issued under the 'without further assessment' criteria, 62 per cent were issued under the 'subject to further assessment' criteria and 1 per cent were issued to organisations. These proportions have remained broadly similar since 1997.
  * On 31 March 2012, 5.0 per cent of the English population held a valid Blue Badge, a decrease of 0.1 percentage points from 2011.
  * In 2011/12, the estimated number of Blue Badges issued in England was 905 thousand, a decrease of 3.4 per cent from the previous year.
  * The overall reduction in number of badges held between 2011 and 2012 has been driven by a decline of 4.3 per cent in the number of badges issued under the 'subject to further assessment' criteria in the last year.

## Browse all statistical tables related to this release

  * [Blue badge scheme statistics statistical tables](/statistics?post_type=table&series=disabled-parking-badges)

## Download the full release and all tables (XLS format)

  * [Blue badge scheme statistics 2011/12 and XLS tables (ZIP - 342 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/blue-badge-scheme-statistics-2011-12/blue-badge-xls.zip)

## Download all tables (CSV format)

  * [Blue badge scheme statistics 2011/12 CSV tables (ZIP - 96 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/blue-badge-scheme-statistics-2011-12/blue-badge-csv.zip)

## Technical information

Information on blue badge statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation can be found here:

  * [Disabled parking badges](/statistics/series/disabled-parking-badges)

## Contact us

  * [parking.data@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:parking.data@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 3094

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [parking.data@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:parking.data@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Port freight statistics: 2011 final figures
summary: This publication presents final detailed statistics on freight handled by major UK ports. It updates and expands on provisional statistics published in July 2012.
body:
![National Statistics logo](/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This publication presents final detailed statistics on freight handled by major UK ports. It updates and expands on provisional statistics published in July 2012. A look-up table cross-referencing tables from the former Maritime Statistics compendium and other printed publications with the new web tables is available with the tables below.

## Download the full release

  * [Port freight statistics: 2011 final figures (PDF - 96 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-final-2011/port-freight-statistics-final-2011.pdf)
  * [Port freight statistics: 2011 printable version (includes final figures, statistical summary and tables PORT0101-0307) - (PDF - 4427 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-final-2011/port-freight-statistics-full-summary-2011.pdf)

## Download the full release and all tables 

  * [Port freight statistics: 2011 final figures and XLS tables (ZIP - 8449 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-final-2011/port-freight-statistics-final-2011-all-files-xls-tables.zip)
  * [Port freight statistics: 2011 final figures and CSV tables (ZIP - 210 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-final-2011/port-freight-statistics-final-2011-all-files-csv-tables.zip)

## Key points

  * In 2011, total freight traffic through UK ports was 519 million tonnes (Mt), an increase of 1 per cent on 2010, but still 11 per cent below the 2005 level. The traffic handled by UK ports has generally grown fairly steadily over the long term. The first decade of the 21st century saw a levelling off of this trend, albeit with the highest ever traffic recorded in 2005. This was followed by a substantial drop of 11 per cent between 2008 and 2009 with the onset of the recession.
  * Compared with 2010, inwards traffic increased by 5 per cent to 328 Mt, whilst outwards traffic decreased by 4 per cent to 192 Mt.
  * Grimsby and Immingham remained the UK's leading port in 2011, handling 57 Mt (11 per cent of UK traffic). It was followed by London with 48.8 MT (9 per cent), Milford Haven with 48.7 Mt (9 per cent) and Southampton with 38 Mt (7 per cent).
  * In 2011, UK major ports handled 15.3 million freight units, almost unchanged compared with 2010. They also handled 6.0 million passenger vehicles, a decrease of 4 per cent on 2010.
  * Dover, the top UK port for roll-on roll-off (ro-ro) freight, handled 2 million ro-ro main freight units (road goods vehicles, unaccompanied trailers and shipborne port-to-port trailers).
  * Felixstowe was the UK's largest container port handling 2 million containers.

## Browse all statistical tables related to this series

  * [Port freight statistics: all statistical tables](/statistics?post_type=table&series=ports-parent-series)
  * [Freight traffic through UK ports (by weight)](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=port01)
  * [Unitised traffic through UK ports](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=port02)
  * [Key port stats including top ports by cargo category and maps](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=port03)
  * [Tables for individual ports including pivotable tables](/statistics?statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=port04)
  * [Ship arrivals by port](/statistics?statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=port06)
  * [Table index cross-referencing web tables with Maritime Statistics and other printed publications](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/series/ports/maritime-table-index.xls)

## Technical information

Information on port freight statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation are available at:

  * [Port freight statistics](/statistics/series/ports/)

## Related statistical releases

  * [Port freight statistics: quarter 2 (provisional)](/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-quarter-2-2012/)
  * [Port freight statistics: Annual (provisional)](/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-2011-annual-provisional/)

## Contact us

  * [maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 4131

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Port freight statistics: quarter 2 2012
summary: This release presents provisional summary statistics on freight handled by major UK ports, updated quarterly.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This publication presents provisional summary statistics on freight handled by major UK ports, updated quarterly. Provisional annual statistics are updated in June and detailed final annual statistics are published in September. See related statistical releases below.

## Download full release

  * [Port freight statistics: quarter 2 2012 (PDF - 50 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-quarter-2-2012/port-freight-statistics-quarter-2-2012.pdf)

## Download full release and all tables 

  * [Port freight statistics: quarter 2 2012, XLS and CSV tables (ZIP - 303 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/port-freight-statistics-quarter-2-2012/port-freight-tables-quarter-2-2012.zip)

## Key points

### Year ending Q2 2012 compared with year ending Q2 2011

  * Total port traffic (tonnage) in the year ending Q2 2012 was down 1 per cent on the year ending Q2 2011.
  * The number of units of all types handled in the year ending Q2 2012 was down 2 per cent compared with the year ending Q2 2011.

### Latest quarter compared with same quarter of previous year

  * Tonnage in Q2 of 2012 was down 3 per cent compared with Q2 2011.
  * The number of units of all types handled in Q2 2012 was down 3 per cent compared with Q2 2011.

title: Public attitudes towards train services
summary: This publication summarises adults' experiences of, and attitudes towards, rail travel in the United Kingdom using questions asked on the Office for National Statistics Opinions omnibus survey in April 2012.
body:
## Summary

This publication summarises adults' experiences of, and attitudes towards, rail travel in the United Kingdom using questions asked on the Office for National Statistics Opinions omnibus survey in April 2012. It covers:

  * short distance rail journeys of less than 50 miles and long distance rail journeys of more than 50 miles;
  * the accessibility of railway stations; 
  * the frequency and purpose of rail journeys;
  * how users and non-users rate and perceive rail services;
  * whether experiences have met expectations;
  * which features users most value;
  * why non-users and infrequent users do not use services more often and what improvements would encourage them to use trains more often, and
  * opinions on the number and range of train tickets available and their ratings of a number of ticket features.

## Download the full release

  * [Public attitudes towards train services: results from the April 2012 Opinions Survey (PDF - 189 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/public-attitudes-towards-train-services-april-2012/rail-report-2012.pdf)
  * [Public attitudes towards train services: April 2012 questions (PDF - 77 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/public-attitudes-towards-train-services-april-2012/rail-questions-2012.pdf)

## Download the full release and all tables

  * [Public attitudes towards train services: April 2012 - all XLS tables (ZIP - 204 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/public-attitudes-towards-train-services-april-2012/rail-xls-tables.zip)
  * [Public attitudes towards train services: April 2012 - all CSV tables (ZIP - 23 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/public-attitudes-towards-train-services-april-2012/rail-csv-tables.zip)

## Browse all statistical tables related to this series

  * [Public attitudes towards train services: April 2012 statistical tables](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=att04)

[Index sheet of all train services statistical tables (XLS - 20 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/public-attitudes-towards-train-services-april-2012/rail-table-index.xls)

## Pre-release access list

The post holders given pre-release access for up to 24 hours prior to release.

  * [Pre-release access list (PDF - 11 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/public-attitudes-towards-train-services-april-2012/pre-release.pdf)

## Background and technical information

  * [ONS Opinions survey](http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/about-ons/who-we-are/services/opinions-and-lifestyle-survey/opinions-and-lifestyle-survey--opn-.html)

## Contact us

  * [rail.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:rail.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 6203

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)

title: Quarterly bus statistics: quarter 2 2012
summary: This Statistical Release presents data on local bus passenger journeys and fares in Great Britain up to Q2 (April to June) 2012, and annual statistics on bus punctuality.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This Statistical Release presents data on local bus passenger journeys and fares in Great Britain up to Q2 (April to June) 2012, and annual statistics on bus punctuality.

## Download full release

  * [Quarterly bus statistics Q2 2012 (PDF - 58 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/quarterly-bus-statistics-q2-2012/bus-q2-2012.pdf)

## Download full release and all tables

  * [Quarterly bus statistics and XLS tables (ZIP - 263 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/quarterly-bus-statistics-q2-2012/q2-tables-xls.zip)
  * [Quarterly bus statistics CSV tables (ZIP - 13 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/quarterly-bus-statistics-q2-2012/q2-tables-csv.zip)

## Key points

### Passenger journeys

Comparing Q2 (April to June) 2012 with the same quarter in the previous year:

  * There was no change in bus passenger journeys in England with a 1.2 per cent increase for London, a 0.4 per cent decrease in metropolitan areas, and a decrease of 2.0 per cent in non-metropolitan areas.
  * Over the same period there was a decrease of 1.6 per cent in passenger journeys in Scotland, and a decrease of 5.3 per cent in Wales.

Comparing Q2 (April to June) 2012 with the previous quarter, there was a fall of 2.1 per cent in seasonally adjusted bus passenger journeys in England, with falls in each area type. Quarter on quarter changes should be interpreted with caution.

### Bus fares index

Comparing June 2012 with June 2011:

  * There was an increase in bus fares of 6.5 per cent in England (5.4 per cent in London, 6.8 per cent in metropolitan areas and 7.6 per cent in non-metropolitan areas). The all items retail prices index increased by 2.8 per cent over this period.
  * Over the same period there was an increase of 5.4 per cent in fares in Scotland, and an increase of 9.6 per cent in Wales.

### Bus punctuality

  * In 2011/12, an estimated 82.7 per cent of non-frequent bus services in England ran on time (defined as between 1 minute early and 5 minutes 59 seconds late).

## Browse statistical tables related to this series

  * [Buses statistical tables](/statistics?orderby=date&post_type=table&series=buses)

## Technical information

Information on bus statistics, including the pre-release access list and related technical documentation, can be found here:

  * [Buses](/statistics/series/buses/)

## Related statistical releases

  * [Annual Bus Statistics 2010/11](/statistics/releases/annual-bus-statistics-201011)

## Contact us

  * [bus.statistics@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:bus.statistics@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 3076

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [bus.statistics@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:bus.statistics@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: August 2012
summary: This Statistical Release presents information about the reliability of journeys on motorways and ‘A’ roads managed by the Highways Agency during August 2012.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This Statistical Release presents information about the reliability of journeys on motorways and 'A' roads managed by the Highways Agency during August 2012.

## Download the full release

  * [Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: July 2012 (PDF - 54 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/reliability-of-journeys-highways-agency-motorway-a-road-network-aug-2012/oct-2012-congestion-ha-network-stats-release.pdf)

## Download the full release and all tables

  * [Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: August 2012 and all XLS tables (XLS - 52 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/reliability-of-journeys-highways-agency-motorway-a-road-network-aug-2012/reliability-of-journeys-on-ha-motorway-and-a-roads-aug-2012-xls-tables.zip)
  * [Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: August 2012 CSV tables (ZIP - 1 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/reliability-of-journeys-highways-agency-motorway-a-road-network-aug-2012/reliability-of-journeys-on-ha-motorway-and-a-roads-aug-2012-csv-tables.zip)

## Key points

  * In the year ending August 2012, provisional data show that 82.9 per cent of journeys on the Highways Agency managed network were 'on time'. This is 0.1 percentage points lower than the previous year, ending July 2012.
  * The annual reliability measure consistently increased up to March 2012, but has fallen in the last five months.
  * Provisional data show that 81.9 per cent of journeys on the Highways Agency network during August 2012 were 'on time', down 1.6 percentage points from August 2011.

## Browse statistical tables related to this series

  * [Congestion and reliability statistical tables](/statistics?post_type=table&series=congestion-and-reliability)

## Technical information

Information on congestion and reliability statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation are available at:

  * [Congestion and reliability](/statistics/series/congestion-and-reliability/)

## Contact us

  * [congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 6579

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: July 2012
summary: This Statistical Release presents information about the reliability of journeys on motorways and ‘A’ roads managed by the Highways Agency during July 2012.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This Statistical Release presents information about the reliability of journeys on motorways and 'A' roads managed by the Highways Agency during July 2012.

## Download the full release

  * [Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: July 2012 (PDF - 50 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/reliability-of-journeys-highways-agency-motorway-a-road-network-july-2012/sep-2012-congestion-ha-network-stats-release.pdf)

## Download the full release and all tables

  * [Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: July 2012 and all XLS tables (XLS - 48 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/reliability-of-journeys-highways-agency-motorway-a-road-network-july-2012/reliability-of-journeys-on-ha-motorway-and-a-roads-july-2012-xls-tables.zip)
  * [Reliability of journeys on Highways Agency's motorway and 'A' road network: July 2012 CSV tables (ZIP - 1 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/reliability-of-journeys-highways-agency-motorway-a-road-network-july-2012/reliability-of-journeys-on-ha-motorway-and-a-roads-july-2012-csv-tables.zip)

## Key points

  * In the year ending July 2012, provisional data shows that 83.0 per cent of journeys on the Highways Agency managed network were 'on time'. This is 0.2 percentage points lower than the previous year, ending June 2012.
  * The annual reliability measure consistently increased up to March 2012, but has fallen in the last four months.
  * Provisional data show that 81.8 per cent of journeys on the Highways Agency network during July 2012 were 'on time', down 2.5 percentage points from July 2011.

## Browse statistical tables related to this series

  * [Congestion and reliability statistical tables](/statistics?post_type=table&series=congestion-and-reliability)

## Technical information

Information on congestion and reliability statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation are available at:

  * [Congestion and reliability](/statistics/series/congestion-and-reliability/)

## Contact us

  * [congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 6579

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:congestion.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Reported Road Casualties Great Britain: annual report 2011
summary: Detailed statistics about the circumstances of personal injury accidents, including the types of vehicles involved, the resulting casualties and factors which may contribute to accidents.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This publication presents detailed statistics about the circumstances of personal injury accidents, including the types of vehicles involved, the resulting casualties and factors which may contribute to accidents. In addition to detailed tables there are six articles containing further analysis on specific road safety topics.

Most of the statistics in the publication are based on information about accidents reported to the police. However, other sources such as mortality, survey and hospital data are also used as well as population and traffic data to provide a wider context.

## Download the full release

  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain 2011: summary (PDF - 68 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-00.pdf)
  * [General overview and trends in reported casualties (PDF - 195 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-01.pdf)
  * [A valuation of road accidents and casualties in Great Britain in 2011 (PDF - 45 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-02.pdf)
  * [Drinking and driving 2011 (PDF - 94 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-03.pdf)
  * [Contributory factors to reported road accidents 2011 (PDF - 122 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-04.pdf)
  * [Self-reported drink and drug driving 2011 (PDF - 60 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-05.pdf)
  * [Hospital admissions data on road casualties 2011 (PDF - 141 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-06.pdf)
  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain - complete report (PDF - 12.6 MB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-complete.pdf)

## Download the full release and all tables

  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain 2011 - PDF files (ZIP -- 765 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-all-pdf-files.zip)
  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain 2011 - all XLS tables (ZIP -- 1.9 MB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-all-xls-files.zip)
  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain 2011 - all CSV tables (ZIP -- 328 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-all-csv-files.zip)

## Key points

Key findings from the RRCGB 2011 report include:

  * In 2011, there were a total of 203,950 casualties of all severities in road accidents reported to the police, 2 per cent lower than in 2010. There were 1,901 people killed, a 3 per cent increase than in 2010 and 23,122 were seriously injured, up 2 per cent. Motor vehicle traffic increased slightly (0.2 per cent) over the same period.
  * The number of fatalities fell for three types of road user, with a fall of 22 per for bus and coach occupants, 10 per cent for motor cyclists, 4 per cent for pedal cyclists. Pedestrian and Car occupants rose by 12 and 6 per cent respectively.
  * In 2011, it is estimated 9,990 reported casualties (5 per cent of all road casualties) occurred when someone was driving whilst over the legal alcohol limit. The provisional number of people estimated to have been killed in drink drive accidents was 280 (15 per cent of all road fatalities).
  * The rate per billion vehicle miles for total casualties in reported road accidents and the rate of people killed or seriously injured (KSI) in 2011 were both 15 per cent lower than the 2005-09 average. For fatalities alone, the 2011 rate was 32 per cent lower than the average.
  * Failed to look properly was again the most frequently reported contributory factor and was reported in 42 per cent of all accidents reported to the police in 2011.
  * In 2011, the economic welfare cost of reported road accidents was estimated to be around £15.6 billion.

  
  


## Browse all statistical tables related to this series

  * [Road accidents and safety - all statistical tables](/statistics?orderby=date&post_type=table&series=road-accidents-and-safety-series)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on accidents](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras10)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on drivers and vehicles](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras20)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on casualties](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras30)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on accidents, casualties and vehicles](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras40)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on outcome indicators](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras41)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on drinking and driving](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras51)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on contributory factors](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras50)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on self-reported drink and drug driving](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras511)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on hospital admissions data on road casualties](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras55)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on valuation of road accidents and casualties](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras60)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on international comparisons](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras52)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables on inter-modal comparisons](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras53)
  * [RRCGB 2011 tables traffic, population etc.](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&s=ras90)

Tables providing regional and local authority figures are titled: RAS30038 - RAS30058, RAS10014 - RAS10015, RAS41002 - RAS41004

## Technical information

Information on road accidents and safety statistics, including related technical documentation (notes and definitions, STATS19 form and instructions for completion) are available at:

  * [Road accidents and safety](/statistics/series/road-accidents-and-safety/)
  * [RRCGB 2011 - notes to tables (PDF - 26 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-notes-to-tables.pdf)
  * [Calendar of events (PDF - 26 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-annual-report-2011/rrcgb2011-events-calendar.pdf)

## Related statistical releases

  * [Reported road casualties Great Britain: main results 2011](/statistics/releases/reported-road-casualties-gb-main-results-2011)
  * [Earlier RRCGB annual reports can be found here](http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20110503151558/http://dft.gov.uk/pgr/statistics/datatablespublications/accidents/casualtiesgbar/)

## Contact us

  * [roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 6595

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Reported road casualties Great Britain: provisional estimates Q1 2012
summary: This publication presents statistics on personal injury accidents in the year ending March 2012 on public roads (including footways) in Great Britain, which became known to the police within 30 days.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This publication presents statistics on personal injury accidents in the year ending March 2012 on public roads (including footways) in Great Britain, which became known to the police within 30 days.

Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain: Quarterly Provisional Estimates is a series providing estimates of personal injury road accidents and their casualties. These estimates are published to allow emerging trends to be monitored between the publications of annual figures.

## Download the full release

  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain: Quarterly Provisional Estimates (PDF - 100 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012.pdf)

## Download full release and all tables

  * [Quarterly estimates Q1 2012 XLS tables (ZIP - 135 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012-xls.zip)
  * [Quarterly estimates Q1 2012 CSV tables (ZIP - 12 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012-csv.zip)

## Key points

  * For reported road accidents in the year ending March 2012; 1,870 people were killed, a 1 per cent drop from the year ending March 2011 (1,881). 
  * However the number of people killed or seriously injured rose to 25,210, a 1 per cent increase compared to the year ending March 2011 (24,849). 
  * Overall for year ending March 2012; there were 202,980 reported road casualties (slight, serious injuries and fatalities), which is 3 per cent less than the year ending March 2011. 
  * Total reported child casualties (ages 0-15) fell by 3 per cent, from 19,784 to 19,130 with those killed or seriously injured down 2 per cent (2,460), compared with the previous 12 month period. 
  * Road injury accidents reported to the police fell by 2 per cent (to 150,810) while fatal accidents fell by less than 0.5 per cent (to 1,770) compared with the year ending March 2011 (at 1,774). 
  * In comparison, motor vehicle traffic levels have risen by 0.6 per cent compared to the 12 month period ending March 2011.

## Browse statistical tables related to this series

  * [Road accidents and safety](/statistics?s=ras45&orderby=title&post_type=table&series=road-accidents-and-safety-series)

## Technical information

A note on the methodology and definitions used to produce these estimates can be found at:

  * [Methodology](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q1-2012/methodology-note-quarterly-estimates.pdf)

Information on Road Safety statistics and definitions, including the pre-release access list, and other relevant publications can be found here:

  * [Road accidents and safety](/statistics/series/road-accidents-and-safety/)

## Contact us

  * [roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 6595

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Reported road casualties Great Britain: provisional estimates Q2 2012
summary: This publication presents statistics on personal injury accidents in the year ending June 2012 on public roads (including footways) in Great Britain, which became known to the police within 30 days.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This publication presents statistics on personal injury accidents in the year ending June 2012 on public roads (including footways) in Great Britain, which became known to the police within 30 days.

The Quarterly Provisional Estimates series provides in-year estimates of personal injury road accidents and their casualties. These are published to allow emerging trends to be monitored between the publications of annual figures.

## Download the full release

  * [Reported Road Casualties in Great Britain: Quarterly Provisional Estimates (PDF - 68 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012.pdf)

## Download full release and all tables

  * [Quarterly estimates Q2 2012 XLS tables (ZIP - 128 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012-xls.zip)
  * [Quarterly estimates Q2-2012 CSV tables (ZIP - 12 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012-csv.zip)

## Key points

  * In the year ending June 2012; 1,790 people were killed in reported road accidents, a 6 per cent drop from the year ending June 2011 (1,901). However, the number of people killed or seriously injured in the year ending June 2012 rose to 24,870, a 1 per cent increase compared with the year ending June 2011 (24,610).
  * Comparing Q2 2012 against Q2 2011 shows a 6 per cent fall in total deaths and serious injuries, and an 18 per cent fall in deaths alone. However, in general, single quarter comparisons should be treated with caution as data are more subject to distortion by short-term factors such as extreme weather. Q2 2012 saw extremely wet weather across England, which may affect comparison with earlier years.
  * Overall for year ending June 2012; there were 148,100 reported injury accidents and 199,740 reported casualties of any severity (slight injuries, serious injuries and fatalities), falls of 3 per cent and 4 per cent respectively from to the year ending June 2011 figures. In comparison, motor vehicle traffic levels have risen by 0.1 per cent in the year ending June 2012.

## Browse statistical tables related to this series

  * [Road accidents and safety](/statistics?s=ras45&orderby=title&post_type=table&series=road-accidents-and-safety-series)

## Technical information

A note on the methodology and definitions used to produce these estimates can be found at:

  * [Methodology](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-accidents-and-safety-quarterly-estimates-q2-2012/methodology-note-quarterly-estimates.pdf)

Information on Road Safety statistics and definitions, including the pre-release access list, and other relevant publications can be found here:

  * [Road accidents and safety](/statistics/series/road-accidents-and-safety/)

## Contact us

  * [roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 6595

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:roadacc.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Road lengths in Great Britain: 2011
summary: This statistical release presents estimates for road lengths in Great Britain in 2011.
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This statistical release presents estimates for road lengths in Great Britain in 2011.

## Download full release

  * [Road lengths in Great Britain: 2011 (PDF - 46 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-lengths-in-great-britain-2011/road-lengths-2011.pdf)

## Download full release and all tables

  * [Road lengths in Great Britain 2011 and XLS tables (ZIP - 939 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-lengths-in-great-britain-2011/road-lengths-2011-xls.zip)
  * [Road lengths in Great Britain 2011 CSV tables (ZIP - 46 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/road-lengths-in-great-britain-2011/road-lengths-2011-csv.zip)

## Key points

  * The total road length in Great Britain in 2011 was estimated to be 245.0 thousand miles, an increase of 2.1 thousand miles (0.9 per cent) over 10 years.
  * Minor roads made up 87 per cent of total road length, with motorways and 'A' roads accounting for 1 per cent and 12 per cent respectively.
  * Despite accounting for only 13 per cent of road length in 2011, major roads (motorways and 'A' roads) accounted for 65 per cent of road traffic.
  * The trunk road network (centrally managed motorways and 'A' roads) accounted for 7.5 thousand miles, a decrease of 1.7 thousand miles since 2001. This decrease reflects the government's de-trunking program (the transfer of centrally managed roads to local authorities).

## Browse all statistical tables related to this series

  * [Road lengths statistical tables](/statistics?post_type=table&series=road-lengths-series)

## Technical information

Information on road lengths statistics, including pre-release access list:

  * [Road lengths](/statistics/series/road-lengths/)

## Related statistical releases

  * [Road traffic estimates 2011](/statistics/releases/road-traffic-estimates-2011/)

## Contact us

  * [road.length@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:road.length@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 3180

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)

title: Shipping fleet statistics: 2011
summary: This publication presents summary statistics on UK and world shipping fleets, updated annually. Data are generally updated simultaneously with releases in the port freight statistics series.
body:
## Summary

This publication presents summary statistics on UK and world shipping fleets, updated annually. Data are generally updated simultaneously with releases in the port freight statistics series.

## Download the full release

  * [Shipping fleet statistics: 2011 (PDF - 42 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/shipping-fleet-statistics-2011/shipping-fleet-statistics-2011.pdf)

## Key points

  * There were 730 UK owned trading vessels, totalling 20.5 million gross tons, or 22.5 million deadweight tons. Of these 730 vessels, 162 were tankers, 140 were ro-ro vessels, 114 were container ships and 78 were bulk carriers.
  * 930 trading vessels were UK parent owned, totalling 27.2 million gross tons and 35.2 million deadweight.
  * 1,228 trading ships were UK managed, totalling 49.4 million gross tons or 63.8 million deadweight tons.
  * All three of these fleets, as well as the UK Registered fleet, have grown substantially over the previous decade. However, growth has generally levelled off over the last 2-3 years, and the size of the UK parent owned fleet declined after 2008, although it partly recovered in 2011.
  * The world trading fleet at the end of 2011 consisted of over 55,000 vessels, totalling 983 million gross tons, or 1.47 billion tons deadweight.

## Browse all statistical tables within this series

  * [Shipping fleet statistical tables](/statistics?orderby=title&post_type=table&series=shipping-fleet)

## Technical information

Information on shipping fleet statistics, including the pre-release access list, and related technical documentation, can be found here:

  * [Shipping fleet](/statistics/series/shipping-fleet)

## Contact us

  * [maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 4119

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:maritime.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format

title: Vehicle licensing statistics Q2 2012
summary: This publication presents information on motor vehicles in Great Britain that were licensed on the 30th June 2012 (the end of quarter 2), or were registered for the first time during quarter 2 (April to June 2012).
body:
![National Statistics logo](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/files/2010/09/nationalstatitics-logo.gif)

## Summary

This publication presents information on motor vehicles in Great Britain that were licensed on the 30th June 2012 (the end of quarter 2), or were registered for the first time during quarter 2 (April to June 2012). The statistics are derived from data held by the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA), which administers vehicle registration and licensing records in Great Britain.

## Download full release

  * [Vehicle Licensing Statistics: quarter 2 2012 (PDF - 62 KB)](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/vls-q2-2012/vls-q2-2012.pdf)

## Key points

  * There were 34.6 million vehicles licensed for use on the roads in Great Britain on the 30th June 2012. Of these vehicles, 28.7 million were cars. The all vehicle figure represents a 0.5 per cent increase on the quarter 2 2011 figure.

Source: [VEH0101](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/tables/veh0101.xls)

  * The prevailing economic situation has a noticeable influence on trends in the number of licensed vehicles, especially commercial vehicles. The numbers of licensed Heavy Goods Vehicles and Buses & Coaches have been on a generally downward trend since the economic downturn began in 2008/09, and the rate of increase in other types of vehicles has slowed.

Source: [VEH0101](http://assets.dft.gov.uk/statistics/tables/veh0101.xls)

  * A total of 604.9 thousand vehicles were registered for the first time in Great Britain during quarter 2 2012. This represents a 3.8 per cent increase in the number of first registrations from quarter 2 2011. There have now been four consecutive quarters on year-on-year increases, of which the latest is the largest. In general, however, first registration numbers have been on a downward trend since 2002.
  * During quarter 2 2012 a total of 961 new ultra-low emission vehicles was registered for the first time (in the UK as a whole). The number of cars and quadricycles was 728, up from 366 in quarter 2 2011. Of these, 473 were cars eligible for the DfT's Plug-in Vehicle Grant.
  * Average CO2 emissions from new cars fell from 134.7 g/km in quarter 1 2012 to 133.2 g/km in quarter 2 2012.
  * The most popular car registered for the first time during the first half of 2012 was the Ford Fiesta, with almost 58 thousand new registrations. The Vauxhall Corsa was the second most popular with 46 thousand registrations, followed by the Ford Focus (43 thousand), Volkswagen Golf (35 thousand) and Vauxhall Astra (30 thousand).

## Browse all statistical tables related to this series

  * [Vehicle licensing statistics: statistical tables](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics?orderby=date&post_type=table&series=vehicle-licensing-parent-series)

## Technical information

Information on Vehicle licensing statistics, including the pre-release access list, can be found here:

  * [Vehicle licensing](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/series/vehicle-licensing)

## Related statistical releases

  * [Vehicle licensing statistics 2011](http://www.dft.gov.uk/statistics/releases/vehicle-licensing-statistics-2011)

## Contact us

  * [vehicles.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:vehicles.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk)
  * Phone: 020 7944 3077

## Help downloading or accessing files

  * See [help with downloads](/site/help/downloads)
  * Email [vehicles.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:vehicles.stats@dft.gsi.gov.uk) for an alternative format
